metadata.title: Ahsan stresses need for a clear roadmap to drive PakistanÃ¢ÂÂs development

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jan 2 (APP):Federal Minister for Planning Ahsan Iqbal on Thursday highlighted the importance of a comprehensive roadmap to ensure Pakistan achieves sustainable development. Speaking to a private news channel, he reflected on the countryas past efforts and outlined the way forward under the new vision of progress. He emphasized that the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) government had introduced Vision 2020-25 in 2013, a strategic plan aimed at placing Pakistan among the top 25 global economies by 2025. The progress we made was disrupted in 2018,a he said while adding that the incoming government buried our development vision, abandoned our policies, and didnat introduce any alternative plan. aThat was like a non-planned period for Pakistanas economic development,a he added. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif launched aUraan Pakistan,a a homegrown five-year national economic transformation plan. aThis plan is aimed at steering the country toward sustainable growth from the macroeconomic stability,a he added. He said that aUraan Pakistana aims to place Pakistan on the path of sustainable high growth, moving towards a stronger and more prosperous future.
content.summary: Ahsan Iqbal, the Federal Minister for Planning, emphasized the need for a clear roadmap to ensure Pakistan's sustainable development. He discussed past development efforts, including Vision 2020-25 introduced by the PML-N government, and the current Uraan Pakistan plan launched by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif.
